did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Papers of the United States House of Representatives Committee on Internal Security 1971-1974
did.physloc: Collection located at Ivy Stacks, boxes A23-12 (A-H)

accessrestrict.head: This collection is not available for use until early 2012. Please contact Special Collections for additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United States House of Representatives Committee on Internal Security Papers, 1972-1974, Accession # 11046-a, Special Collections, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection was a gift from Clifford A. Kiracofe, Jr., Free Union, Va., 08 June 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers of the United States House of Representatives Committee on Internal Security, consisting primarily of office correspondence, intelligence reports, memoranda, and printed materials. Among the collected printed ephemera are publications such as People's Yellow Pages of America, The Call Political Newspapers of the October League, and The Daily World. There are also files on alleged radical organizations, such as: Operation Push, Communist Party, USA, the Sparticist League, and the Harrisburg 8. Also included are card files, House Committee manuals on Internal Security, and miscellaneous Department files.
